metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28116 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Squid through 4.14 and 5.x through 5.0.5, in some configurations, allows information disclosure because of an out-of-bounds read in WCCP protocol data. This can be leveraged as part of a chain for remote code execution as nobody.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.12').
